data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix travis on macOS. (#135)

When trying to install python3 from homebrew, travis was
complaining that it couldn't overwrite python2 symlinks
with python3 symlinks.  Follow the advice given by homebrew
and unlink python@2 before trying to install python3.  This
fixes travis on macOS for me.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Brett
data.message:
Fully resolved placeholder to avoid confusion (#57)

Updated the use of the _1 placeholder to use the fully resolved namespace to avoid confusing the compiler in the event that boost/function.hpp was included.

There are some headers that include boost function (e.g., OgreMeshManager.h) that cause a conflict when the placeholder is specified without its namespace. This keeps that from happening.

Serialize initial library loads

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Serialize initial library loads

class_loader_core uses static entities to create global objects. Well it turns out that the loadLibrary function can be called multiple times simultaneously, and because of the static objects, we end up starting a new load before another finishes, causing a persistent failure when loading the first library.

This commit adds a mutex to ensure that this critical section of the loadLibrary function is not interrupted by another library load.

data.message: fix inconsistency in PocoConfig.cmake leading to CMake warning (regression of ab035a58a6306c67dd16c75b1917e0ab882e4a02)

data.author: v4hn
data.message:
Check for Poco/SharedLibrary.h instead of arbitrary AbstractCache.h

SharedLibrary.h is included in the code, so it makes sense
to check for this header specifically.

data.author: v4hn
data.message:
Poco detection is too confident when seeing /usr/include/Foundation

That folder is also provided by gnustep-base.
Ubuntu encapsulates the gnustep headers in a GNUstep folder,
however the project itself installs to /usr/include/Foundation
and other linux distributions(Archlinux, Gentoo, Lunar-Linux, ...)
respect this.

data.author: Mirza Shah
data.message: Added more granular synchronization locks to class_loader_core. Mutex locking problem when plugins create other plugins on construction time. The global lock of class_loader_core would cause the system to lock because a plugin on creation would acquire the lock and then when it would try to create more plugins during construction, it cannot acquire lock.

data.author: mirzashah
data.message: Fixed problem with libraries containing more than plugin code being automatically dlopened() and creating factories without a valid active ClassLoader. Fixed it by allowing ClassLoaders to create objects of non-owned metaobjects with a warning. In the 99.999% case, those metaobjects had to have come from the library that was prematurely opened, so this behavior works fine. Anyway, this should solve everybody's woes. Also added a lot more error messages and made existing ones more meaningful
